elements.title: Kefah Ali Deeb
elements.contents: ... that Syrian artist Kefah Ali Deeb painted an empty chair (pictured) as her vision of victims and refugees?

elements.title: Richmond Theatres
elements.contents: ... that three of the four Richmond Theatres were destroyed by fire, of which the 1811 fire was described as "early America's first great disaster"?

elements.title: Claude Hamilton Verity
elements.contents: ... that Claude Hamilton Verity, a grandson of Doncaster mayor Charles Verity, was an early pioneer of the synchronisation of sound with silent films?

elements.title: a TV station in Jacksonville
elements.contents: ... that one of the "plushest" nightclubs in northern Florida turned into studios for a TV station in Jacksonville?

elements.title: her party's fourth congress
elements.contents: ... that Left Socialist-Revolutionary leader Maria Spiridonova addressed her party's fourth congress in October 1918 by letter as she was in jail?

elements.title: KT Leveston
elements.contents: ... that KT Leveston, the 254th pick in the 2024 NFL draft, is from U.S. area code 254?

elements.title: cannot raise their heart rates sufficiently during exercise
elements.contents: ... that many people with heart failure, diabetes, or ME/CFS cannot raise their heart rates sufficiently during exercise?

elements.title: Aza Arnold
elements.contents: ... that within years of Aza Arnold inventing a device to improve cotton roving, it was plagiarized across the United States and Europe?

elements.title: Aurora Gaming
elements.contents: ... that Aurora Gaming's roster for Apex Legends is made up of Fire Beavers?
